intro: Panicum heterophyllum var. thinium, commonly known as slender panicgrass, is a grass species native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its slender,丛生 growth habit and narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear numerous tiny flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and wetland restoration projects.
